name: USCoreImmunizationProfile
title: US Core Immunization Profile
description: This profile sets minimum expectations for the Immunization resource to record, search, and fetch immunization history associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource and constrains the way the elements are used when using this profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: statusReason
elements.description: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: vaccineCode
elements.description: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: patient
elements.description: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: occurrence[x]
elements.description: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: recorded
elements.short: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
elements.description: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: primarySource
elements.short: (USCDI) Indicates context the data was recorded in
elements.description: Indicates whether the data contained in the resource was captured by the individual/organization which was responsible for the administration of the vaccine rather than as 'secondary reported' data  documented by a third party. A value of 'true' means this data originated with the individual/organization which was responsible for the administration of the vaccine.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reportOrigin
elements.short: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
elements.description: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

binding.description: The source of the data for a record which is not from a primary source.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PAT] (this syntax for self-reported) .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=LIC] (this syntax for health care professional) .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PRS] (this syntax for family member)

elements.name: location
elements.description: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXA-27  (or RXA-11, deprecated as of v2.7)

elements.name: manufacturer
elements.description: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: lotNumber
elements.description: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: expirationDate
elements.description: Date vaccine batch expires.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: site
elements.description: Body site where vaccine was administered.

binding.description: The site at which the vaccine was administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: route
elements.description: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

binding.description: The route by which the vaccine was administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: doseQuantity
elements.description: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performer
elements.description: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: function
elements.short: What type of performance was done
elements.description: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

binding.description: The role a practitioner or organization plays in the immunization event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: actor
elements.short: Individual or organization who was performing
elements.description: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: note
elements.description: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.description: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.description: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: isSubpotent
elements.description: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subpotentReason
elements.description: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

binding.description: The reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: education
elements.description: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentType
elements.description: Identifier of the material presented to the patient.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reference
elements.description: Reference pointer to the educational material given to the patient if the information was on line.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publicationDate
elements.description: Date the educational material was published.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: presentationDate
elements.description: Date the educational material was given to the patient.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: programEligibility
elements.short: Patient eligibility for a vaccination program
elements.description: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

binding.description: The patient's eligibility for a vaccation program.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: fundingSource
elements.description: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

binding.description: The source of funding used to purchase the vaccine administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reaction
elements.short: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
elements.description: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

elements.name: series
elements.description: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.
